intro: Manihot labroyana, commonly known as the Brazilian arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy rhizomes that are used as a starch source. The plant produces small, greenish flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are typically heart-shaped with a smooth texture. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and ample sunlight. Due to its nutritional value, it has been cultivated for both culinary and medicinal purposes.
